Text: Band (rock and pop):  The four-piece band is the most common configuration in rock and pop music.

Text: Band (rock and pop):  Before the development of the electronic keyboard, the configuration was typically two guitarists (a lead guitarist and a rhythm guitarist, with one of them singing lead vocals), a bassist, and a drummer (e.g. the Beatles, KISS, Franz Ferdinand).

Text: Band (rock and pop):  Instrumentally, these bands can be considered as trios.
